datasource: Schneider-Blum, Gertrud. 2007. A grammar of Alaaba: A cushitic east highland Language of Ethiopia. Cushitic Language Studies 25. Köln: Rüdiger Köppe Verlag ['GS2007', 'p' for 'page', 't' for 'table']

Vowels.inventory: i e a o u; ii ee aa oo uu

Prosody.Type: 'Alaaba is not a tone language but it does employ pitch accent as a grammatical means' [GS2007p.22

geodemoTXT: Varieties and subdialects of Alaaba are spoken in the 'Oromia region: Rift Valley southwest of Lake Shala, separated by Belate river from Kambatta [ktb] language area'.

termclusters.label: alb-morphVerb-CausativeStemsCC-final
termclusters.note: GS2007t53p304 :: There is both a simple and a double causative (caus,causD),each with two 'overlapping allomorphs' ,as follows:caus1 –s-,causD1  –siis-,caus2 –siis-,causD2 –siisiis-. The paradigm gives the occurrence of these allomorphs in correlation with the stem-final consonaInt

termclusters.label: alb-morphVerb-CausativeStemsNeutral
termclusters.note: sbt47p293 :: Form vs. Function of the causative of causative. Simple causatives ['Causative'] can have -(i)s- ['Causative1'] or -(i)siis- ['Causative2']. Correspondingly,  double causatives ('CausativeD') will have -(i)isiis- ('CausativeD1') or -(i)siisiis ('Cas=usativeD2'.[noteSelf: Use pandas to transform table as in SBp293]
